bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, December 12, 1900

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, December 12, 1900
div1.p:
This has
been a very happy day for
me- First because I received
two darling letters from my
sweet little “widow”, the last
telling of her improve-
ment under Dr Nash's
skillful treatment -- of course,
Dr Nash said you were growing
“fatter and prettier”, every
day! How could he truth-
fully say any thing else
about my sweet Miss
Invalid? It only goes
to show that Dr Nash is
a man of good taste!
Tell him that I say so!
Do you mean to tell me that
you are not going to tackle
that, mint-bed again? oh!
Come away, Miss Farmer-
lady, and tell that yarn to
somebody who doesn't know
you as well as old Mr
Mosquito! It won't be
long before you will
have forgotten all about
that gout: and then oh!
my! how spring chicken
and J. Barley corn will
disappear! I'll tell you
what, sweetheart, will
be good for your gouty
toes and “juits”- Some of
those -- indeed a plenty-
of those delicious grapes
that will be growing on
the vines at Keewaydin, next
year! I'll write and tell
Johnnie Moore to put some
more bone-meal around
them, so that they will fairly
run riot with themselves.
I only wish that it was
the first of May and we
were getting ready to
go up and plant that pre-
cious garden of ours!
What would I give to see
dearest mother bending
over her flower-beds,
and fat, pink scholar
busy weeding her flower
bed, too! While Jakie
hoed the corn and com-
complained of a very bad
headache! He! He! Ho! Ho!

I didn't say that you must
go out, lovie, dear, whether
it rained or “shined”, or
whether “juits” ached or not-
Don't accuse your precious
Mosquito of that! I would
never advise you to try to
walk on a foot that was
painful- It must have been
“some other fellow” who gave
you that advice! Stay in
doors when the weather is
threatening, and keep away from
Woodward & Lothrop's! That
is a very bad place! I
shouldn't be one bit
surprised if you caught
your gout right there in
that store! Keep away from
it, at least, till I get another
check! He! He! Ha! Ha! Ho! Ho!
